examples: give me a quick overview of iconnect
tell me all features of iconnect
what for we use this iconnect
Type of questions you can answer
responses:
iConnect is an employee self-service portal used to manage HR and work-related tasks. It includes modules like:

- Leaves: Apply for LOP, Diversity, Privilege, and Flexi Leave
- Holiday List: Check holidays in Dashboard or Personal
- Useful Links: Access iSupport, Helpdesk (raise tickets), and ADP ESS (payslips & tax slips)
- Timesheet: Fill and submit before 22nd each month
- Employee Search: Find employees by name or code
- Newsletter: Get monthly company updates
- iTravel: Request domestic/international travel and view history
- iVisa: Request visa for official travel
- iForex: Manage currency exchange for travel
- iTraining: Register for training sessions
- iReimbursement: Create and check reimbursements
- Risk Management: Report and track identified risks

examples: What are the steps to apply leave
can you tell me the process to apply leave
how do I request a leave
what is the procedure to apply leave
responses: To apply for leave, go to **Personal â†’ Leaves â†’ Apply Leave**. Select day type (full/half), leave type, from date, to date, and provide a comment before submitting.

examples: where do I apply for leave
in which section can I apply leave
responses: You can apply for leave under **Personal â†’ Leaves â†’ Apply Leave**.

examples: what is day type in leave application
difference between full day and half day leave
can I apply for half day leave
what is morning half and second half leave
what are the types of leaves in a day
responses: Day type refers to whether you are applying for a **Full Day** or **Half Day** leave (Morning Half or Second Half).

examples: what are the types of leaves
which leave types can I apply for
what is sick leave or casual leave
responses: Common leave types include **Loss of Pay (LOP)** and **Diversity Leave**. Based on roles, employees may also have **Privilege Leave** and **Flexi Leave** as options.

examples: when can I take diversity leave
responses: Diversity Leave is a special category of leave provided for **inclusivity purposes**. Please check companyâ€™s HR policy for detailed eligibility.

examples: how to select from date and to date in leave
can I apply leave for multiple days
how to apply for 2 days leave
how to give start and end date of leave
responses: When applying for leave, select the **From Date** and **To Date** to specify your leave duration. For a single day, both dates should be the same.

examples: what to write in comment while applying leave
should I give explanation when applying leave
how to provide reason for leave
responses: When applying for leave, you must enter a **comment** to specify the reason for your leave request.

examples: how to check list of holidays of all branches

responses: You can check the holiday list in **Dashboard â†’ Holiday List** or **Personal â†’ Holidays**.

responses: Some holidays are company-wide, while others may vary based on your office location or region. Please check your **Personal â†’ Holidays** section for the holidays applicable to you.
You can check the upcoming holiday in **Dashboard â†’ Holiday List**, where the nearest holidays are displayed.

responses:
Here is the holiday list for 2025:

- **January**: New Year (01-01-2025), Makara Sankranti (14-01-2025)
- **February**: No holidays
- **March**: Holi (14-03-2025), Ramzan (31-03-2025)
- **April**: Good Friday (18-04-2025)
- **May**: May Day (01-05-2025)
- **June**: No holidays
- **July**: No holidays
- **August**: Independence Day (15-08-2025), Ganesh Chaturthi (27-08-2025)
- **September**: No holidays
- **October**: Vijaya Dasami & Gandhi Jayanti (02-10-2025), Diwali (21-10-2025 & 22-10-2025)
- **November**: No holidays
- **December**: Christmas (25-12-2025)

examples: where can I find useful links
what are the links in useful links
responses:
You can access Useful Links from **Dashboard â†’ Useful Link**, where you will find:

- **iSupport** â†’ For Trainings (Login or Register).
- **Helpdesk Application** â†’ To raise tickets for any IT-related queries (Login or Register).
- **ADP ESS** â†’ For payslips, declarations, Form 16, and other tax-related documents (Login or Register).

examples: what can we do in isupport
what types of trainings are available in itraining?
responses:
iSupport is used for training-related support. You need to login (https://isupport.intelizign.com/) with your employee ID and password to access the training modules.

Mostly available trainings include **Polarion, Mendix, DevOps, and Teamcenter**.

examples: how to raise ticket in helpdesk
can I get IT support in helpdesk
responses: The Helpdesk Application is for IT support. You must login or register(https://helpdesk.intelizign.com/) and then raise a ticket for any IT-related issues.

Here is the link: [ADP ESS Login](https://www.vista.adp.com/in/V6/ess/login)

examples: where can I fill my timesheet
responses: You can access the Timesheet from Personal â†’ Timesheet.

examples: before which date should I complete my timesheet
responses: Timesheets must be filled before the 22nd of every month.

examples: what details should I give in timesheet
how to enter hours in timesheet
responses:
In the Timesheet, you need to mention how many hours you worked, what tasks you did each day, and select the appropriate task.

- If you are in a **non-billable project**, fill in **8 hours** per day.
- If you are in a **billable project**, fill in the **actual hours worked** on the project.

After entering the details, click the **'Save Timesheet'** button to save your entries.

examples: is there a save button in timesheet
how do I confirm timesheet submission
responses: After filling your timesheet, click the 'Save Timesheet' button to save your entries. Without clicking Save, the details will not be stored.

examples: do I need to fill timesheet on holidays
how to enter weekends in timesheet
are holidays auto filled in timesheet
what about weekends in timesheet entry
responses: If it is a holiday or weekend, the system will automatically take it by default. You do not need to manually enter details for those days.

You can access iTravel from Personal â†’ iTravel.
When an employee needs to travel for work, they can claim their travel, stay, and ticket expenses through **iTravel**.

responses: To apply for travel, go to Personal â†’ iTravel and fill in the required fields. Provide travel details, select domestic or international, and then submit your request.

difference between domestic and international travel
can I book domestic and international trips in iTravel
responses: iTravel provides two options: Domestic Travel and International Travel. Select the appropriate option when applying.

examples: can I see my travel history

responses: Yes, iTravel allows you to view the history of your previous travel requests.

examples: where is the iVisa option available

The iVisa module is used to request a visa when you need to travel abroad for official purposes.

responses: To request a visa, go to Personal â†’ iVisa, fill in the required details, and submit your request for processing.

responses: In iVisa, you need to provide travel details and required information for processing your visa request. Additional documents may be required depending on the destination country.

examples: where is the iForex option available
responses: You can access iForex from Personal â†’ iForex.

what information should I give for forex

responses: In iForex, you need to provide your travel details and required information to process the foreign currency exchange request.

examples: where is the iTraining option available
responses: You can access iTraining from Personal â†’ iTraining.
The iTraining module is used to register for training sessions organized by the company.

responses: To register for a training session, go to Personal â†’ iTraining, select the session you want, and complete the registration process.

examples: where can I find create reimbursement
where is the reimbursement option available
responses: You can access it from iReimbursement â†’ Create Reimbursement.

examples: why do we need create reimbursement
responses: The Create Reimbursement option is used to claim allowances and expenses incurred during official work.

examples: what types of reimbursement are there
which categories are available in reimbursement
what are the options in create reimbursement
responses: In Create Reimbursement, you can claim two types: Allowances and Expenses.
To create a reimbursement, go to iReimbursement â†’ Create Reimbursement, select allowance or expense, fill in all required details, save it, and then submit for approval.

examples: what details are needed for reimbursement
what information should I give in reimbursement form
what to fill in reimbursement request
responses: In the reimbursement form, you need to provide details such as type (allowance or expense), amount, purpose, date, and attach supporting bills if applicable.

examples: where can I find my reimbursement
where is the my reimbursement option available
responses: You can access it from iReimbursement â†’ My Reimbursement.

examples: what is my reimbursement used for
why do we need my reimbursement
when should I use my reimbursement
responses: The My Reimbursement option allows you to check all your submitted reimbursements and the amounts received.

examples: what are the types of allowances
responses:
In **iReimbursement**, there are different types of allowances and expenses:

**Allowances:**
- Accommodation Allowance
- Interview Allowance
- Joining Bonus
- Local Conveyance Allowance
- Onsite Allowance - International
- Referral Bonus
- Relocation Bonus

**Expenses:**
- Business Promotion
- Computer
- Food
- Internet
- Kit Allowance
- Learning and Development
- Lodging
- Postage and Stationery
- Subscription and Licenses
- Telephone
- Travel

You can claim these through the **iReimbursement** portal.

examples: how do I know if reimbursement is approved
responses: You can check the status of your reimbursement under iReimbursement â†’ My Reimbursement, where approval and payment details are listed.
All past reimbursements can be viewed in the My Reimbursement section with details of claim type, date, and amount.

examples: where can I find risk identification

responses: You can access it from **Risk Management User â†’ Risk Identification**.

responses: The **Risk Identification** module is used to report problems or risks in specific categories so that they can be addressed properly.

examples: what are the steps to submit my complaint

responses: To report a risk, go to **Risk Management User â†’ Risk Identification**, mention the exact location or category of the problem, provide a detailed description, and then submit.

examples: what details are needed for risk identification
what information should I give in risk report
what to fill in risk identification form
which fields are mandatory in risk identification
what is risk identification used for
responses: In the **Risk Identification** form, you must specify where the problem exists, describe the issue in detail, and then submit for further review.

examples: where can I find risk identified
where is the risk identified option available
i want to raise a complaint
i want to complaint regarding generator backup
responses: You can access it from **Risk Management User â†’ Risk Identified**.

examples: what is risk identified used for
why do we need risk identified
when should I use risk identified
i want to raise a complaint
responses: The **Risk Identified** module is used to view the reports of risks / complaint that you have already submitted.

examples: where can I check my risk reports
how do I know which risks I reported
responses: You can see the details of risks you reported under **Risk Management User â†’ Risk Identified**.

examples: how to check status of my risk
who is handling my risk report
responses: In the **Risk Identified** section, you can check the details and current status of the risks you have submitted.
